intro: Reseda tricuspis, commonly known as the three-lobed catchfly, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many showy flowering plants. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are characterized by their three-lobed shape. Reseda tricuspis is often found in dry, disturbed soils and can thrive in rocky or sandy environments. It is not widely cultivated but is sometimes grown for its ornamental value.
